meanings.definition: A woman who lives with a man but has lower status than his wife or wives.
meanings.sent1: In ancient times, concubines often had to serve the main wife.
meanings.sent2: The king had many concubines in his palace.
meanings.sent3: The concubines in the story were always trying to impress the main wife.
meanings.sent4: Her role in the company felt like being a concubine to the CEO.
meanings.sent5: The concubines' quarters were elegantly decorated but lacked freedom.

meanings.definition: A woman who has a sexual relationship with a man but is not married to him.
meanings.sent1: The historical novel depicted the life of concubines in the royal court.
meanings.sent2: She discovered her husband's secret affair with a concubine.
meanings.sent3: The concubine's presence at the family gathering caused quite a stir.
meanings.sent4: His addiction to work made him a concubine to his job.
meanings.sent5: The forbidden love story revolved around a concubine and a nobleman.
